name: market for sewage sludge, dried | sewage sludge, dried | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/17659/documentation

This is a market activity, representing a treatment mix. In the case of products needing treatment, market mixes are supplied by the activities treating the product in the geography defined by the market, and they supply the activities needing to treat the product, as they have generated it as a by-product in the Undefined processes (present as a negative input in system models). Transport to the treating facility or losses are also accounted in this type of markets, when relevant.;This dataset represents the supply of 1 kg of 'sewage sludge, dried' from activities that produce it within the geography of CH. Transportation is included in this market. It is assumed that most of the waste produced in Switzerland is also treated in Switzerland, that is why a regional Swiss market is created for the treatment of sewage sludge, dried. The transport distances used for calculating the transport amounts in this market are taken from a model based on statistics on transport of goods in Switzerland (Valsasina, 2016, Default transport data per commodity group for Switzerland, ecoinvent, www.ecoinvent.org).

This activity starts at the gate of the activities that produce 'sewage sludge, dried' within the geography of this dataset, with the product ready for transportation. No losses are considered during the transportation.

This activity ends with the supply of 1 kg of 'sewage sludge, dried' to the consumers of this product. Transport is included. Product losses during transportation are assumed negligible and are therefore not included.
category: C:Manufacturing/23:Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products/239:Manufacture of non-metallic mineral products n.e.c./2394:Manufacture of cement, lime and plaster

exchanges.description: The transport distances in this market are taken from a model based on statistics on transport of goods in Switzerland (Valsasina, 2016, Default transport data per commodity group for Switzerland, ecoinvent, www.ecoinvent.org). The distances are then multiplied by the wet mass of the reference product, which is specified in the exchange properties.
